concept.title: Comstar overview
concept.shortdesc: The Comstar User and Attendant's Guide is designed to help you use your telephone's features to your best advantage.

section.title: Terms you'll need to know
section.p: The following terms will help you understand some of the instructions in this guide.

dlentry.dd: A receptionist or other person responsible for answering incoming calls.
The numbered keys on your telephone, including the # and *.
The buttons or keys on your telephone that allow you to press a single button to make conference calls, program your telephone, use the speakerphone, and others.
The telephone receiver that you use to listen and speak.
The calls you make to other telephones inside your organization.
The buttons you use to select the outside line you want to use to make a call.
The small lights next to the line buttons on your telephone.
A built-in feature of your telephone that lets you speak and hear a conversation without using the handset. The following telephones have a built-in speakerphone: 16-button, 30-button, and 42-button.
The buttons you use to select other extensions in the system.
On the single-line telephone, the button in the handset cradle.
The 64-button accessory that contains 60 telephone line buttons and lamps and four function buttons. DSS/BLF stands for Direct Station select/Busy Lamp Field.
